lexUnit.name: absorbing.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: arousing and fully holding one's attention

sentence.text: He accepts that his children play less than other children , but considers this is normal for children of high ability who demand more absorbing tasks .
Lauda crops up again in Maurice Hamilton 's informative tome The British Grand Prix , an absorbing record of this country 's most important fixture on the international racing calendar .
That goal , three minutes from the end of extra-time in an absorbing semi-final , gives Liverpool another chance against Second Division Portsmouth in a replay at Villa Park a week today .
A playground and playhouse keep the tots happy while the teenagers have a ball with a whole host of absorbing activities .
It closes with a reading of a series of formulae from one of his papers but even here , where the ` mathematicalness " of the performance is forced on you , the dance is more absorbing .
All of which adds up to an absorbing daily life and one in which any time that she spends on her own , when she often dwells on her sad past , is kept to a minimum .
For some women at this stage , cooking can become an absorbing hobby rather than the necessity of life it was when there were others to feed -- a social pleasure or simply a personal indulgence .
A visit to the Museum in an unexpected delight and an absorbing pleasure .
This is one of the most absorbing accounts of this tragic masterpiece which I have heard recently , and I would confidently place it among the very best of recorded versions .
Frankly , I found Frankenstein about as absorbing as shiny bog-roll -- this sort of flickscreen platformer went out with Jet Set Willy !
Stomping around the 40-odd screens that make up the playing area , solving puzzles and avoiding the numerous nasties , is as absorbing as you can get for four pounds .
Directed by Val May , this archly absorbing escapade also features Deborah Watling ( Emma Kent ) , and Rowland Davies as the police inspector with an eye for apprehension .
He found it addictive , stimulating , endlessly absorbing , and he allowed nothing-certainly no personal involvements -- to distract him .
An old manual sir camera and a cheap set of extension tubes is all that is needed to get one started in this absorbing hobby .
A hobby that demands complete attention is refreshing because it is totally absorbing .
His is one of many stories told in this absorbing book .
Set in Chile , men and women , spirits , the forces of nature and history come together in an unforgettable , wholly absorbing and brilliantly realised epic drawn from Allende 's best selling novel .
Of course this ca n't be a first choice for Lohengrin , but those who have any interest in the history of the opera 's performance will find it a consistently absorbing experience .

In the course of the eleventh and twelfth centuries aristocratic society -- courtly society -- came to look upon sexual love , its desires and its complications , as an absorbing and fashionable subject .
Advertising writing is an absorbing and interesting job with lots of laughs and lots of rewards , not least financially , if you prove to be good at it .
I felt quite calm again , as divorced from my own immediate problems as if I were coming out after seeing a particularly absorbing film .
Personally , I find them less absorbing than the book that contrives to tell only one story , with as many ramifications as may be .
She lived in the present tense of the school with its totally absorbing pattern of routine and minor rebellion .
The most absorbing topic to me was what was going on in Lebanon and , increasingly , Iran .
Jenny blinked rapidly , like one returning from an absorbing daydream .
When the group is multilingual and all communication has to be in the target language , an absorbing task of this kind is an excellent communicative activity .
In spite of an inauspicious beginning , Laura and Bernard succeeded within a few years in developing an absorbing private life in their adopted country .
Out along the railway lines between 1880 and 1930 there developed ` a metropolitan corridor " , whose history J. R. Stilgoe has traced in his absorbing book of the same title .
After sixteen years of fishing for zander I still find it a magical absorbing pastime .
FLY tying has become an absorbing hobby for Jim Lister as he puts the finishing touches to another specimen during his lunch break in the BMK canteen .
Matilde Landeta 's films were equally absorbing .
And then she 'll miss all those amazingly absorbing dinner parties with great heads of states like Billy Bubongoronga from Back-of-Beyond province or whatever .
His tussle in midfield with McKinlay was one of the highlights of an absorbing contest .
